meanings.definition: To cut or gather (a crop or harvest)
meanings.sent1: The farmer reaped the ripe wheat from the field.
meanings.sent2: She reaped the apples from the orchard in the autumn.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow tried to reap the corn, but it kept falling apart.
meanings.sent4: He reaped the rewards of his hard work after a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent5: The villagers watched as the reaper reaped the golden grains under the sun.

meanings.definition: To receive as a consequence of one's own or others' actions
meanings.sent1: She reaped praise for her excellent performance in the play.
meanings.sent2: He reaped the benefits of his kindness when others helped him in return.
meanings.sent3: The cat reaped attention by knocking over the vase and pretending it was an accident.
meanings.sent4: The student reaped the consequences of staying up late to finish the assignment.
meanings.sent5: The team reaped victory after months of hard training and dedication.

meanings.sent1: He reaped a good grade on the test after studying diligently.
meanings.sent2: The explorer reaped valuable knowledge from his travels around the world.
meanings.sent3: The magician reaped a round of applause after his impressive disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: She reaped the benefits of her investment when the stock prices soared.
meanings.sent5: The detective reaped crucial evidence from the crime scene to solve the mystery.
